subtests.name: A ScrollTimeline can be created with a scrollSource
A ScrollTimeline can be created with a non-scrolling scrollSource
A ScrollTimeline created with a null scrollSource should use the document.scrollingElement
A ScrollTimeline created with the default orientation should default to 'block'
'block' is a valid orientation value
'inline' is a valid orientation value
'horizontal' is a valid orientation value
'vertical' is a valid orientation value
Creating a ScrollTimeline with an invalid orientation value should throw
A ScrollTimeline created with the default startScrollOffset should default to 'auto'
A ScrollTimeline created with the default endScrollOffset should default to 'auto'
'auto' is a valid scroll offset value
'0' is a valid scroll offset value
'calc(100% - 80px)' is a valid scroll offset value
'em' is a valid scroll offset unit
'ex' is a valid scroll offset unit
'ch' is a valid scroll offset unit
'rem' is a valid scroll offset unit
'vw' is a valid scroll offset unit
'vh' is a valid scroll offset unit
'vmin' is a valid scroll offset unit
'vmax' is a valid scroll offset unit
'cm' is a valid scroll offset unit
'mm' is a valid scroll offset unit
'q' is a valid scroll offset unit
'in' is a valid scroll offset unit
'pc' is a valid scroll offset unit
'pt' is a valid scroll offset unit
'px' is a valid scroll offset unit
'%' is a valid scroll offset unit
'' is an invalid scroll offset value
'calc(360deg / 4)' is an invalid scroll offset value
'left' is an invalid scroll offset value
'#ff0000' is an invalid scroll offset value
'rgb(0, 128, 0)' is an invalid scroll offset value
'url("http://www.example.com/pinkish.gif")' is an invalid scroll offset value
'this_is_garbage' is an invalid scroll offset value
'100px 5%' is an invalid scroll offset value
'deg' is an invalid scroll offset unit
's' is an invalid scroll offset unit
'Hz' is an invalid scroll offset unit
'dpi' is an invalid scroll offset unit
A ScrollTimeline created with the default timeRange should default to 'auto'
'auto' is a valid timeRange value
'0' is a valid timeRange value
'-100' is a valid timeRange value
'100' is a valid timeRange value
'1234.5678' is a valid timeRange value
'invalid' is an invalid timeRange value
'Infinity' is an invalid timeRange value
'-Infinity' is an invalid timeRange value
'NaN' is an invalid timeRange value
A ScrollTimeline created with the default fill should default to 'none'
'none' is a valid fill value
'forwards' is a valid fill value
'backwards' is a valid fill value
'both' is a valid fill value
'auto' is a valid fill value
Creating a ScrollTimeline with an invalid fill value should throw
